history.proof: intros A P dp. sfirstorder depth: 3use: depprod_ind.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type), depprod A P -> A

Premises:
depprod : forall A : Type, (A -> Type) -> Type
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
depprod_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (P0 : depprod A P -> Type), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (dep_i A P x p)) -> forall d : depprod A P, P0 d
depprod_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (P0 : depprod A P -> Set), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (dep_i A P x p)) -> forall d : depprod A P, P0 d
depprod_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (P0 : depprod A P -> Prop), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (dep_i A P x p)) -> forall d : depprod A P, P0 d
depprod_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (P0 : depprod A P -> SProp), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (dep_i A P x p)) -> forall d : depprod A P, P0 d
dep_i : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> depprod A P
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Ens_rect : forall P : Ens -> Type, (forall (A : Type) (e : A -> Ens), (forall a : A, P (e a)) -> P (sup A e)) -> forall e : Ens, P e
Power = fun E : Ens => match E with | sup A f => sup (A -> Prop) (fun P : A -> Prop => sup (depprod A (fun a : A => P a)) (fun c : depprod A (fun a : A => P a) => match c with | @dep_i _ _ a _ => f a end)) end : Ens -> Ens
rew_pair : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Type) (x1 x2 : A) (y1 : P x1) (y2 : Q x1) (H : x1 = x2), (eq_rect x1 P y1 x2 H, eq_rect x1 Q y2 x2 H) = eq_rect x1 (fun x : A => (P x * Q x)%type) (y1, y2) x2 H
Union = fun E : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Ens) (fun (A : Type) (f _ : A -> Ens) => sup (depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x))) (fun X : depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) => depprod_rect A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) (fun _ : depprod A (fun x : A => pi1 (f x)) => Ens) (fun (a : A) (b : pi1 (f a)) => pi2 (f a) b) X)) E : Ens -> Ens
Relation_Operators.right_lex : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : forall x : A, B x -> B x -> Prop) (x : A) (y y' : B x), leB x y y' -> Relation_Operators.lexprod A B leA leB (existT B x y) (existT B x y')
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive lexprod (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (leB : forall x : A, B x -> B x -> Prop) : {x : A & B x} -> {x : A & B x} -> Prop := left_lex : forall (x x' : A) (y : B x) (y' : B x'), leA x x' -> Relation_Operators.lexprod A B leA leB (existT B x y) (existT B x' y') | right_lex : forall (x : A) (y y' : B x), leB x y y' -> Relation_Operators.lexprod A B leA leB (existT B x y) (existT B x y') Arguments Relation_Operators.lexprod _%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.left_lex _%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.right_lex _%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
pi1 = fun X : Ens => Ens_rect (fun _ : Ens => Type) (fun (A : Type) (_ : A -> Ens) (_ : A -> Type) => A) X : Ens -> Type
sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens
List.hd : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> A
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
Inter = fun E : Ens => match E with | sup A f => sup (depprod A (fun a : A => depprod (pi1 (f a)) (fun b : pi1 (f a) => forall x : A, IN (pi2 (f a) b) (f x)))) (fun c : depprod A (fun a : A => depprod (pi1 (f a)) (fun b : pi1 (f a) => forall x : A, IN (pi2 (f a) b) (f x))) => match c with | @dep_i _ _ a (@dep_i _ _ b _) => pi2 (f a) b end) end : Ens -> Ens
List.In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
BinList.jump : forall A : Type, BinNums.positive -> list A -> list A
List.tl : forall A : Type, list A -> list A
Inductive Ens : Type := sup : forall A : Type, (A -> Ens) -> Ens Arguments sup _%type_scope _%function_scope
Ring_polynom.Pol_ind : forall (C : Type) (P : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Prop), (forall c : C, P (Ring_polynom.Pc c)) -> (forall (p : BinNums.positive) (p0 : Ring_polynom.Pol C), P p0 -> P (Ring_polynom.Pinj p p0)) -> (forall p : Ring_polynom.Pol C, P p -> forall (p0 : BinNums.positive) (p1 : Ring_polynom.Pol C), P p1 -> P (Ring_polynom.PX p p0 p1)) -> forall p : Ring_polynom.Pol C, P p

```coq
intros A P dp.
induction dp using depprod_ind.
intros x p.
exact x.
Qed.
```

original: intros A P dp. induction dp using depprod_ind. intros x p. apply x.
